c: ^Kay: Yeah, just had to deal with usual beratement from 'rents -
^Kay: I forgot to do the dishes so I'm a terrible person or some shit like that.
^Kay: Yeah, I just took my time getting here.
^Kay: I forget sometimes that this town is kinda pretty.
^Vanya: Yeah bt we've seen it all a million times. Does that mean it's still pretty?
^Kay: Yeah, not gonna lie I did not want to leave my room.
^Kay: I had a pretty perfect summer malaise going on; any longer and I was going to get eaten by the couch.
^Vanya: I get that! I've been watching "American Ninja Warrior" non-stop, just 'cos there's nothing else on.

g-0: ^Vanya: Over at the tower. Let's go see what's up.

I_i_All: ^Kay: Nothing much - What have you guys been up to?
^Halle: I watched "The Avengers" for the 18th time today - I'm convinced it's a film without flaws.
^Vanya: Oh yo so a guy came into the Gas N' Go today after filling up - bought a Snickers and a single lottery ticket, right?
^Vanya: He won ten grand and I wanted to suplex him for it SO BAD.
^Halle: You're too loud to be a fugitive.
^Kay: What would you do with the cash?
^Kay: If you won $10,000 right now, bam, in your wallet, no questions asked.
^Halle: Well first off, after taxes it's probably more like eight grand, so keep that in mind-
^Vanya: Booooo. Don't bring taxes into this. I have to do them myself this year it sucks.
^Halle: So given EIGHT grand what would you do?
^Halle: I'd invest it - it's not much but it'd become something by the time I'm like, forty.
^Kay: New phone, new clothes, laptop, bass guitar. All the essentials.
^Vanya: I don't have a bank account, so I'd stuff it into my mattress and never tell my parents.
^Halle: How the hell do you still not have a bank account?
^Vanya: Hey I don't wanna deal with that. I get paid in cash and it goes under my sleeping butt where it belongs.
^Halle: Okay what about a MILLION dollars-
^Kay: Your mattress would be very lumpy and I don't know how you'd hide that from your parents.
^Vanya: My mattress would be full of LIES.
^Kay: I dunno man, there isn't really space for big dreams nowadays.
^Vanya: I try not to think about that stuff.
^Kay: Let's get out of here. This shit's too picturesque.
I_ii_All: ^Halle: This place is about as dead as it gets.
^Kay: It sucks that the cinema closed.
^Vanya: It sucks that the cinema got the emergency exits fixed so we couldn't sneak in during trailers.
^Kay: Yeah. One less thing to do around here, and the list was getting pretty short already.
^Halle: Speaking of shit to do, Vanya did you hear anything?

g-0: ^Vanya: Oh! Yeah he said there's a thing happening at Kelly Fleming's place.
^Halle: I'm bored and feel like doing something stupid,

II_i_main: ^Halle: Aight so Vanya you're off to choose your beau?
^Vanya: I guess so? Ugh this is gonna suck no matter what huh.
^Kay: It might? It might also go super well and you have two life-long friendships, both of whom you got to make out with at different times.
^Kay: More likely yeah it gets awkward as fuck.
^Kay: Are you planning some kind of mischief?
^Halle: I'm in a mischief mood, yeah.
^Halle: Hey everyone says I should learn how to drink BEFORE I go to college, so why not?
^Halle: What are you going to do?
^Kay: I uhh am just going to hang out. I dunno.
^Kay: Yeah totally, that's the word people usually use to describe these things right?
II_ii_Halle_to_Kelly: ^Kelly: I uhh, don't remember inviting you?
^Halle: My RSVP must have been misplaced in the mail.
^Kelly: I mean you're welcome to hang out, I just didn't think this was your scene.
^Halle: It usually isn't, but I heard about it through the grape-vine and couldn't resist. Not a hell of a lot happening this summer.
^Kelly: Yeah. Umm, listen. Just- just don't start anything alright? I'm just trying to have a cool party.
II_iv_main: ^Matt: Have you been like, checked out for this?
^Kay: Nope. Then they'd give me pills and I wouldn't feel shit and that freaks me out way more.
^Matt: I kinda assumed you were too cool and detached to have emotions and shit.

c: ^Kay: Yeah well, everyone getshanded a stereotype and I never fought mine.
^Kay: If no one thinks they can get a rise out of you then they won't even try.
^Kay: Well that sucks, 'cos like we probably could've met and been friends BEFORE I was out here having a fucking freak out.
^Kay: There are a bunch of people that would probably be rad to talk to, but they all think I don't give a shit.

g-0: ^Kay: Fuck why am I dumping this all on you, I just met you like ten minutes ago.
^Matt: We met at the Lakeview Drive block party when we were like, six or something.
^Kay: I don't like that you remember that.
^Kay: Did we have some quirky interaction you'll never forget?
^Matt: No, no, our parents introduced us and you totally bailed.
^Matt: More importantly Devin, Ryan, and I were busy stealing cookies and running into the woods to get away from it all. Even at that age we knew block parties weren't cool.
^Matt: My point is we all know each other, even if we don't hang out. It's a small town.
^Matt: There's nobody at this party I wouldn't hang out with.
^Kay: Well shit I can think of at least-

c: ^Kay: Real talk 76% of these people make me want to ramp into Quincy quarry.
^Matt: That's fucked up, rad as the image is.

g-1: ^Matt: Then why the heck are you here?
^Kay: Vanya and Halle wanted to go, they're my friends so I did. It's a small town.
^Matt: Scrappy but loyal, girls who break shit. Can I join your gang?
